name: stammer
content:
Add to word list

to speak or say something with unusual pauses or repeated sounds, either because of speech problems or because of fear or nervousness : [ + speech ] "Wh-when can we g-go?" she stammered. He dialled 999 and stammered (out) his name and address. Compare
stutter verb (SPEAK)
bumble
More examplesFewer examplesI stammered a bit when I was a boy.She stammered an apology and ran out of the room.He stuttered and stammered about having a busy schedule that week.

a speech problem in which someone speaks with unusual pauses or repeated sounds : Robert has a slight stammer. Speech lessons had corrected a childhood stammer.
the act of saying something with unusual paused or repeated sounds because of fear or nervousness: Although he said he felt calm, there was a slight stammer in his voice. She was a gangly girl of 15, all stammers and blushes.
More examplesFewer examplesHer older brother had a slight stammer from an early age.Despite a lifelong stammer, he resolved that he was going to make his fortune as a singer.Davis' voice didn't have a single stutter, stammer or pause. Machines don't understand the stammers and stalls, "uhms," "likes," and grammatical errors of natural speech.
